Posts.Title: Scared... and concerned about delay of imaging lauramsd Ariom

Posts.Content: Dec 4, 2013 06:17PM - edited Dec 4, 2013 06:18PM by imconcerned I don't think you have IBC... your symptoms would likely be more worsening and more severe, not just a little bit of itching and an enlarged breast. My sister was checked for IBC because of months long itching and a much larger breast after her daughter was born. She even had "puckering" of her nipple. It turns out it was nothing, just a lot of hormonal changes. There are things to look for in IBC such as peau d'orange (which I think you can see if you press down on your breast), an inverted nipple, rash, open sore, bruise redness, heat, etc. If you don't have these things by now, you probably don't have IBC.

The nurse felt a mass at 5 o'clock and told me that it was moveable and the size of a pea. She didn't know if it was a cyst. I honestly thought it was attached to the chest wall, but she felt it was in the breast tissue. Anyway the lump hurts which I've read can be a good sign. They also gave me a referral to get a mammogram. I'm not at all excited to go...in fact, I wonder the same thing about delaying. But, since i've had one sided breast pain this long, i'm not sure a few weeks or a month would make much difference.

Posts.Content: Jan 5, 2014 01:25AM - edited Jan 5, 2014 01:26AM by imconcerned I know of one person diagnosed with BC that was suspicious because of a strange smell under her armpit.  That doesn't mean that you have BC at all, but if you notice a change in your body, you should talk to your doc about it.  Also, they say BC doesn't normally hurt and the fact that it's in both breasts and that you are young is even better.
